I always use Shiny at work for building dashboards which is challenging and exciting.

```{r}
library(shiny)
```

A curated list of R Shiny Resources to learn from which includes conferences,tutorials,documentations

Shiny Official Site**: [Shiny-Official Site](https://shiny.rstudio.com/)**

Includes all R Packages which can be used with Shiny**:** [**Shiny-Extensions**](https://github.com/nanxstats/awesome-shiny-extensions)

Mastering Shiny by Hadley Wickham**: [Mastering-Shiny](https://mastering-shiny.org/)**

Shiny related books includes(UI Design,Javascript etc): [**Shiny-Books**](https://www.bigbookofr.com/shiny.html)

**Conference Videos/Playlists:**

Appsilon Shiny Conference: [**2022-Conf**](https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLexAKolMzPcrYjGA1PULfm7-P12qjKmPb)

Shiny Developer Series: [**By Eric Nantz**](https://www.youtube.com/c/ShinyDeveloperSeries)

Shiny Dev conf 2016: [**By Joe Cheng**](https://www.rstudio.com/resources/shiny-dev-con-2016/)

RStudio::conf(2022): [**The Past and future of Shiny**](https://www.rstudio.com/conference/2022/keynotes/past-future-shiny/)

Recently,during RStudio::conf(2022) [**Shiny for Python**](https://shiny.rstudio.com/py/) is introduced
